page.title: 11Cropthorne First School
page.content: Cropthorne has a school which accepts children from this village and Charlton. It is a focal point for the community and many of its activities. It is co-educational and takes pupils from 5-10 years old. There is a governing body of 9 members, the Chairman being the Vicar. There are 48 children on roll with a staff of Headteacher, Deputy, Secretary, Dinner Superintendant and Cleaner. School hours are 9.00 to 12.00 and 13.00 to 15.00. The curriculum includes Maths, Reading, English, Environmental Studies, Humanities, Music, Swimming, P.E. and Creative Work. This is a Church of England Controlled School and Religious Education is taught according to the Agreed Syllabus for the County.
